intro: Hieracium macrodon subsp. purpurascenticeps, commonly known as the purple-veined hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are basal, rough, and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with purple veins. The subspecies is distinguished by its distinctive purple-veined petals and robust growth habit.
